txt.en: 'Sithric is a lying, greedy, power-hungry traitor. I must have justice for what was done here! He and I may disagree, but imprisonment and death have never been warranted.\n\n'But perhaps it is time I stand up for what is really right for Stangard and risk breaking the law at last. Free me from these bonds, [placeholder]!'

'You have my gratitude and the lasting friendship of Stangard for what you have done, [placeholder]. You will always be welcome among the Men of Stangard.\n\n'Please... take this as a token of my appreciation! I hope to see more of you here at Stangard, [placeholder], for things will be improving again for my men, no matter what the consequences with the king.'
'Come, my friend. Let us go and end this now. Sithric must pay for what he has done to me... and to Stangard!'
Stanric is alive, defying the lies of Sithric. It is clear that Stanric must be freed at once, so that justice may be done for this betrayal.
Stanric is in the lock-house.\n\nYou should free Stanric from his bonds.
Stanric is now in the Mead Hall, alone, in his proper place.\n\nYou should speak with Stanric once more.
